title: Alaska Public Lands: Directions & Transportation
body: Directions           Bore tides are a phenomenon that can be seen in the Anchorage area. NPS/Fuson  Anchorage: The center is located at 605 W 4th Avenue, downtown Anchorage. It is located within the "Old Federal Building" on the corner of 4thAvenue and F Street. For more detailed directions, please visit: http://www.alaskacenters.gov/anchorage-directions.cfm  Fairbanks: The center is located at 101 Dunkel St. in the Morris Thompson Cultural & Visitor Center next to the Wendell St. Bridge in downtown Fairbanks. For more detailed directions, please visit: http://www.alaskacenters.gov/fairbanks-directions.cfm    Tok: Along the world-famous Alaskan Highway (Milepost #1314.) For more information, please visit: http://www.alaskacenters.gov/tok-directions.cfm  Ketchikan: Downtown, at 50 Main Street, between Bawder, Mill, Main, & SpruceMill Streets one block from the cruise ship dock. For more information, please visit: http://www.alaskacenters.gov/ketchikan-directions.cfm
